flawed_nl_solution:
His utilities cost 1/2 the amount of his $250 car payment so his utilities cost 250/2 = $<<250/2=125>>125
All total, his bills cost him 775+250+125+50 = $<<775+250+125+50=1200>>1200
He makes $2500 a month and his bills cost $1200 a month so that leaves him with 2500-1200 = $<<2500-1200=1300>>1300
He wants to put half of $1300 into a retirement account so he will invest 1300/2= $<<1300/2=650>>650 into his retirement account
He had 1300 and puts $650 into his retirement account so that leaves him with 1300-650 = $<<1300-650=652>>652 remaining
#### 652

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 650, not 652. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
